definition[0]: someone who has been elected to an official position, especially in politics, and who is doing that job at the present time
example[0]: In the June elections, Morris easily defeated the incumbent, Tom Smith.
definition[1]: the person who has a particular job or position at this time, rather than one who wants it or may have it later
example[1]: Nine out of ten incumbents who seek re-election win.
definition[2]: the company that has work from a particular customer at this time
example[2]: The company decided to move the account from the incumbent, Grey Advertising, to another agency.
definition[3]: if it is incumbent on you to do something, it is your duty or responsibility to do it
example[3]: It is incumbent on us to finalize this transaction so that our shareholders can receive their annual premium.
